docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama, who established his bona fides as a gay and lesbian rights champion when he endorsed same-sex marriage, has steadily extended his administration's advocacy to the smallest and least accepted band of the LGBT rainbow: transgender Americans.

headline.main: Without Fanfare, Obama Advances Transgender Rights
headline.print_headline: Without Fanfare, Obama Advances Transgender Rights

docs.lead_paragraph: Republican primary challenger Chris McDaniel puts the nation's $17 trillion debt at the center of his bid to represent Mississippi in the Senate, bashing six-term Sen. Thad Cochran as a profligate spender who has contributed to a problem that McDaniel considers "immoral."

docs.lead_paragraph: A top executive from the UnitedHealth Group is expected to bolster management of the federal insurance marketplace and prevent a repeat of the chaos in the program last fall.
docs.abstract: Obama administration hires Andrew M Slavitt, top executive from the UnitedHealth Group, to bolster management of the federal health insurance marketplace and to prevent a repetition of the chaos that engulfed the program in fall 2013.
docs.snippet: A top executive from the UnitedHealth Group is expected to bolster management of the federal insurance marketplace and prevent a repeat of the chaos in the program last fall.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: All 470 senior executives at the Department of Veterans Affairs received positive annual ratings, according to data released at a congressional hearing on Friday, despite well-publicized problems.

headline.main: Every Senior V.A. Executive Was Rated ‘Fully Successful’ or Better Over 4 Years
headline.print_headline: Every Senior V.A. Executive Was Rated ‘Fully Successful’ or Better Over 4 Years

docs.abstract: Data released at congressional hearing shows that all of the 470 senior executives at the Department of Veterans Affairs received annual ratings over the last four years indicating that they were 'fully successful' in their jobs or even better, despite delays in processing disability compensation claims and problems with veterans’ access to the department’s sprawling health care system.
docs.snippet: All 470 senior executives at the Department of Veterans Affairs received positive annual ratings, according to data released at a congressional hearing on Friday, despite well-publicized problems.

docs.lead_paragraph: More health prescription plans are refusing to cover certain drugs unless the companies charge less for them.

headline.main: Health Insurers Pressing Down on Drug Prices
headline.print_headline: Health Insurers Are Pushing Back on Drug Prices

docs.abstract: Analysts at Credit Suisse estimate that collective discounts and rebates for 15 large drug companies amounted to 31.9 percent of gross United States sales in 2013, up from 30.2 percent in 2012 and 19.7 percent in 2007; change reflects how health prescription plans are refusing to cover certain drugs unless companies charge less for them, which appears to be forcing pharmaceutical makers to compete on price.
docs.snippet: More health prescription plans are refusing to cover certain drugs unless the companies charge less for them.

docs.lead_paragraph: After decades of blocking gay married couples from receiving the same benefits as their heterosexual counterparts, most federal agencies will now treat married couples alike, regardless of gender.

headline.main: Obama Extends Marriage Benefits to Gay Couples
headline.print_headline: Obama Extends Marriage Benefits to Gay Couples

docs.abstract: Federal government announces regulatory changes to extend wide range of marriage benefits to same-sex couples, making good on a promise by Pres Obama after Supreme Court struck down Defense of Marriage Act in 2013.
docs.snippet: After decades of blocking gay married couples from receiving the same benefits as their heterosexual counterparts, most federal agencies will now treat married couples alike, regardless of gender.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Former Louisiana Governor Edwin Edwards, who served eight years in prison for racketeering, leads a crowded field for a November open primary in his bid for a U.S. House of Representatives seat but trails head-to-head against two rivals he could face in a runoff, according to a new poll.

headline.main: Louisiana's Edwards, After Eight Years in Prison, Leads Poll in House Bid
headline.print_headline: Louisiana's Edwards, After Eight Years in Prison, Leads Poll in House Bid

docs.lead_paragraph: Democratic Gov. Terry McAuliffe vowed Friday to bypass the General Assembly and expand Medicaid eligibility for about 400,000 low-income residents on his own, a move Republican lawmakers immediately promised to fight.

headline.main: Va. Governor Vows to Expand Medicaid on His Own
headline.print_headline: Va. Governor Vows to Expand Medicaid on His Own

docs.snippet: Democratic Gov. Terry McAuliffe vowed Friday to bypass the General Assembly and expand Medicaid eligibility for about 400,000 low-income residents on his own, a move Republican lawmakers immediately promised to fight.

docs.lead_paragraph: Moving to prevent more insurance chaos this fall, the nation's new health care chief on Friday revamped the management of HealthCare.gov.
docs.snippet: Moving to prevent more insurance chaos this fall, the nation's new health care chief on Friday revamped the management of HealthCare.gov.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama's new health secretary moved swiftly on Friday to shore up administration oversight of Obamacare with a series of management changes to address weaknesses blamed for last year's crash of the federal website, HealthCare.gov.

headline.main: U.S. Creates New CEO Position for Obamacare Insurance Market
headline.print_headline: U.S. Creates New CEO Position for Obamacare Insurance Market

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama's new health secretary moved swiftly on Friday to shore up administration oversight of Obamacare with a series of management changes to address weaknesses blamed for last year's crash of the federal website, HealthCare.gov.
